name: panegyrical
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
praising someone or something very much by saying good things about them and not mentioning any bad things : Hill had published a panegyrical poem on Peter the Great. The language was standard panegyrical rhetoric comparing the youthful vigour of a new emperor with the mature counsel of an older colleague. See also
panegyric
panegyrist
More examplesFewer examplesThe poet's attitude to Domitian tends to be laudatory and friendly, employing the full spectrum of Virgilian panegyrical language and imagery.In his days as a panegyrical orator he had indulged in lies in front of people who recognized them as such and welcomed them nonetheless.There is not a speech, a poem, or essay, a panegyrical oration in praise of either Athenian liberty or Greek love which does not tell the tale of this heroic friendship.
